definition[0]: the act of increasing prices because costs have increased
definition[1]: relating to people who read someone else’s newspaper or magazine, but do not buy their own copy
example[0]: ‘Animation Magazine’ has one of the highest pass-along rates of any entertainment magazine.
definition[2]: relating to people who pass an email message or computer file on to other people
example[1]: The pass-along rate for an e-zine is much greater than for a Web page. It is easier to forward an e-mail document than a Web page.
